CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week....  Parallel Bars Across Street...one of six taverns in same block as John Wesley AMEZ Church."
TitMainTitle: Herron Avenue at intersection of Wylie Avenue with Christmas decorations and cars parked in front of Cut Rate Drugs, Silverman's Rexall Drugs, Farmers' Fresh Cut Up Poultry shop, and Christ's Temple of Reality in background, Hill District
